014package org.jdbi.v3.guava.codec;
015
016import java.util.Collections;
017import java.util.Map;
018import java.util.Set;
019
020import javax.annotation.concurrent.ThreadSafe;
021
022import com.google.common.reflect.TypeToken;
023import com.google.common.reflect.TypeToken.TypeSet;
024import org.jdbi.v3.core.codec.Codec;
025import org.jdbi.v3.core.codec.CodecFactory;
026import org.jdbi.v3.core.qualifier.QualifiedType;
027import org.jdbi.v3.meta.Alpha;
028
029/**
030 * An extended {@link CodecFactory} which can resolve Codecs for subtypes. This allows registering e.g. a codec for <code>Set&lt;String&gt;</code> and using any
031 * subtype of {@link Set} which the same type parameters (e.g. a <code>HashSet&lt;String&lt;</code>) will find the right codec.
032 * <p>
033 * This is an experimental feature which relies on {@link TypeToken} from the Guava library.
034 */
035@Alpha
036@ThreadSafe
037public class TypeResolvingCodecFactory extends CodecFactory {
038
039    /**
040     * Returns a builder for fluent API.
041     */
042    public static Builder builder() {
043        return new Builder(TypeResolvingCodecFactory::new);
044    }
045
046    public static CodecFactory forSingleCodec(QualifiedType<?> type, Codec<?> codec) {
047        return new TypeResolvingCodecFactory(Collections.singletonMap(type, codec));
048    }
049
050    /**
051     * Create a new TypeResolvingCodecFactory.
052     */
053    public TypeResolvingCodecFactory(final Map<QualifiedType<?>, Codec<?>> codecMap) {
054        super(codecMap);
055    }
056
057    @Override
058    protected Codec<?> resolveType(QualifiedType<?> qualifiedType) {
059
060        // memoize any successful lookup to avoid paying the cost for looking up
061        // a mapping multiple times.
062        return codecMap.computeIfAbsent(qualifiedType, q -> {
063            Codec<?> codec = null;
064            TypeSet candidates = TypeToken.of(q.getType()).getTypes();
065
066            for (TypeToken candidate : (Set<TypeToken>) candidates) {
067                QualifiedType<?> type = QualifiedType.of(candidate.getType());
068                codec = codecMap.get(type);
069                if (codec != null) {
070                    break;
071                }
072            }
073            return codec;
074        });
075    }
076}
